for_sales.sales_text:
Crescent Moon is a 32' long gaff cutter built in Kings Lynn in 1914.  She is a true one-off, with a fishing smack like counter stern, and a more yacht looking curved bow.   She is in excellent structural condition, built of pitch pine planks on oak frames. She can sleep up to 5 people and has been well used by us in our ownership for east coast cruising.

We've undertaken a programme of continual improvements in our 9 year ownership and all aspects of her are fully sorted out and in great shape.

Crescent Moon is a beautiful boat and is a joy to be on, with her fully varnished coach-roof and decks.

We are only selling her due to our retirement and wish to do some blue water offshore sailing.

She is ashore at Pin Mill in Suffolk and ready to sail.

boat.full_description:
Crescent Moon is a smack type yacht, built by William Fox in Kings Lynn in 1914. But we know nothing more about the builder, of whether he worked in a boat yard or as an individual.

She has a square counter-stern similar to a fishing smack, with a rounded bow that is more  typical of a pleasure yacht of her day. She was built as a pleasure yacht, with  paraffin engine, and is said to have been built as a retirement gift for the owner of a boatyard.

Originally she was built as a gaff cutter, complete with a retracting topmast and tops'l , but was converted to bermudan rig in the early 1950's. In 1922 she had a major refurbishment at Kings boat yard in Pin Mill, which included converting her back to gaff rig, as renewing the decks. Her home port has been at Pin Mill on the river Orwell since the late 1980's.
boat.name: Crescent Moon
boat.short_description: Crescent Moon is a lovely gaff cutter, built in pitch pine on oak and is in great condtion.  One of her best features is her beautifiul varnished pine deck and coacroof that make here very distinctive.
